quest.name: Short Arms of the Law
journal: Yozan is ready to begin investigating.
Koharu has found the suspicious Lalafells, and is trailing them. Follow the rest of the Doman Adventurers' Guild to where she is hiding near the southeast gate of Revenant's Toll.

Koharu has found the cart and two of your four suspects. However, this brings up the question of how to prove the criminals' guilt. After a stroke of brilliance, Yozan and Rokka put on a show for the two Lalafells. They pretend that the stolen grimoire contains the location of a hidden treasure. Suitably persuaded, the two suspects run off. Meet with Yozan to the east of Camp Revenant's Toll in hopes of heading off the criminals.

Hiding in a gully, you watch as four Lalafells wander towards the camp, the stolen grimoire in hand. You and the Doman Adventurers' Guild rush towards them, revealing that the tale of treasure was all merely a ploy. In a fit of pique, the leader, Gagarua, calls for his allies to teach you a lesson. Speak with him, and defeat his henchmen should they attack you.
You successfully fend off Gagarua's gang. Now speak with the man himself, and see if he will come quietly.

Upon realizing who you are, Gagarua calls his allies to him, and summons something down upon you from the skies. By the time you realize that this was all a trick, the criminals have run away. However, they have left the aged grimoire in their haste. Retrieve this valuable piece of evidence now.
You have retrieved the grimoire from where it was left. Show it now to Yozan.
Yozan is happy that you now have the means to clear the name of the Doman Adventurers' Guild, and bids you present the aged grimoire to Slafborn back in Revenant's Toll forthwith.

Slafborn gratefully accepts the stolen grimoire, and listens to your tale exonerating the children. Yozan makes it clear that they are all adventurers now, and Slafborn agrees with the hint of a smile on his lips. He watches as the children run away, presumably to find some new quest, and asks that you guide them with a gentle hand, and protect them with your strong arm.
objectives: Speak with Gagarua and defeat his henchmen.
Deliver the aged grimoire to Slafborn.

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: MissMister Forename, Koharu's found our suspects!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: They've parked their cart around the southeast gate. Come on, let's go investigate. But be quiet─we don't want them to know we're onto them yet.

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: I told you I'd find them!

dialogue.name: SHIUN
dialogue.text: What if they're armed? Shouldn't we have weapons, too?

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: I don't know why Koharu thinks this is fun. We're supposed to be clearing our names, aren't we?

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: See? See? Those are our Lalafells, all right!

dialogue.name: SHIUN
dialogue.text: But how do we prove they're our criminals? From here, it doesn't look like they've got the grimoire. Could it be hidden in their cart?

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: The other two might have it as well. Or maybe...we've got the wrong people.

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: I think I've an idea of how to find out. Rokka, can you play along?

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: Have you heard about Rowena's store? They're saying someone stole a grimoire from it!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: That's old news! I think they've even given up hunting for the criminals. <sigh> It's too bad, though. I wanted that grimoire for myself.

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: Why? Because it's got the location of the treasure─

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Shhh! Do you want everyone to know about all the buried gold and jewels!? And what about the weapons, hm?

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: They say those are stronger than the Empire's! I spent so much time learning that the treasure's in Camp Revenant's Toll, but I'll never find it now...

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: Well, not without the grimoire, anyway. So why not just give up while you're ahead?

dialogue.name: WAWATON
dialogue.text: Did you hear that? The lad just said there's gold and silver and weapons out 'round that old camp! Ohoho, imagine how pleased the boss'll be with this! Come on, let's go!

dialogue.name: LILINA
dialogue.text: I'm awake! I'm awa... Huh? Where'd you go?

dialogue.name: WAWATON
dialogue.text: Move yourself, Sister! Time's a-wasting!

dialogue.name: LILINA
dialogue.text: W-Wait! I can't run as fast as you!

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: That was brilliant, Yozan! If they're our criminals, they'll show up at the camp with the grimoire.

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: And if the other two are anything like that duo, we shouldn't have any trouble catching them.

dialogue.name: SHIUN
dialogue.text: That's a relief! I was expecting hardened criminals, but that lot couldn't frighten a baby horsebird.

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: We just have to beat them to Camp Revenant's Toll now. From the way they took the bait, I don't think we have much time. We'd better hurry!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Koharu, are you sure that's them?

dialogue.name: SHIUN
dialogue.text: We're good at passing unseen, but not in the middle of town! Mister Slafborn will see us if we're not really, really careful...

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: Watching Koharu and Yozan work together is exciting, isn't it?

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: I hope they'll come quietly. But if they don't, you'll have to take care of them, MissMister Forename.

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: Gold, jewels, weapons... All hidden somewhere in this dump, where no one would think to look.

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: I think I'll take it all. Garlemald laid my homeland to waste, and so I'll use the riches to rebuild. And the weapons, oh, I will use them to make the world mine!

dialogue.name: BABARA
dialogue.text: Of all the secrets of eld I thought this grimoire held, the location of a lost treasure was not one...

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: Well, 'tis but a matter of knowing where to look. Tell us─how do we read it? Is there a cipher? Or must we use some sort of incantation?

dialogue.name: WAWATON
dialogue.text: Er... That is a good question! I'll be sure to tell you just as soon as I learn the answer!

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: WHAT!? You buffoon! Why did you not think to find out!?

dialogue.name: WAWATON
dialogue.text: Erp! I...I'm sorry, Gagarua, it just didn't seem important at the time!

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text:
(-Gagarua-)Why you─ Hm? What are they doing...?
Go play elsewhere. Adults are working here, children.

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: We're not children─we're the Doman Adventurers' Guild! We're here to arrest you for stealing the grimoire from Rowena's!

dialogue.name: WAWATON
dialogue.text: Oh, oh! Gagarua, those are the children who talked about the treasure! They'll know how to read the grimoire for sure.

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: (-Gagarua-)...

dialogue.name: BABARA
dialogue.text: You two have been had. I knew something smelled fishy about this.

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: (-Gagarua-)You prize pair of pinheads!

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: (-Gagarua-)No one makes a fool of Gagarua, you hear me!? No one! We shall teach these younglings a painful lesson about meddling in others' affairs! Come, summon the thing!

dialogue.name: BABARA
dialogue.text: What thi─ Oh, that. It's not here.

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: (-Gagarua-)...Why is that?

dialogue.name: BABARA
dialogue.text: You sent it away, Gagarua. You said it would draw too much attention to us.

dialogue.name: BABARA
dialogue.text: <sigh> ...So we'll just do the dirty work, then?

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: Oooh, this is all terribly exciting!

dialogue.name: SHIUN
dialogue.text: We learned how to wait silently and unseen in Doma. Yozan never took to it as well as we did, though...

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: It's all very well waiting around for our criminals, but what do we do once they're here?

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: One of you against all three of mine? Hah! You don't stand a...a mammet's chance in the hells!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Just do like you did with Mister Boulder, MissMister Forename!

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: I'll leave them to you, MissMister Forename. But someday, I'll show you what Miss Yda taught me!

dialogue.name: SHIUN
dialogue.text: This doesn't seem like a fair fight. Can we help? From back here, I mean.

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: I'll heal you if you get hurt, MissMister Forename! Later. When I have a potion.

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: Twelve above, where did those younglings find so puissant a protector!?

dialogue.name: BABARA
dialogue.text: I've got a feeling I've seen herhim before... Wait! Quick, everyone, come here!

dialogue.name: BABARA
dialogue.text: It's little wonder we were outmatched─that is Forename Surname, the hero of the Scions!

dialogue.name: WAWATON
dialogue.text: You don't mean the lasslad who's beaten a load of primals, and smashed the imperial...er, ultimatum weapon to bits!?

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: We can discuss herhis deeds and why shehe is with the children later, Wawaton! Babara, Lilina, we must do as we practiced!

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: Ahem... Well met, Scion! Yes, we know full well who you are. But hear me─you won't be adding us to your list of fallen foes! Are you ready, my friends?

dialogue.name: GAGARUA
dialogue.text: As our forefathers before us, we have a winged beast in our thrall, whose strength is so great as to tear primals in twain and turn brave men to whimpering wretches! O mighty Valefor, we summon you with our prayers─descend from the heavens, and vanquish our foes!

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: ...Isn't something supposed to happen?

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Damn it, they got away!

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: Hey! There they go. Faster than they look, aren't they?

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: That was a queer bunch, make no mistake! But they forgot one thing─the grimoire!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Come on, MissMister Forename─get them!

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: Wow! You beat them faster than you beat Mister Boulder, MissMister Forename!

dialogue.name: SHIUN
dialogue.text: Something tells me this isn't over...

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: They're much better at talking about fighting than actually fighting...

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: MissMister Forename, get the grimoire.

dialogue.name: KOHARU
dialogue.text: They seemed fun. I hope I can talk to them again, someday.

dialogue.name: SHIUN
dialogue.text: They turned tail and ran when they learned who you were, MissMister Forename.

dialogue.name: ROKKA
dialogue.text: I wonder how those four are related...

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Hah! Now that we've got the grimoire, all we need to do is show it to Mister Slafborn and explain what happened! Come on, what are we waiting for?

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: What did the Doman children have to say for themselves?

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: The younglings and the grimoire? So it is as I feared, and they are responsible for stealing it, yes?

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Gagarua? No, I cannot say I am familiar with him. But if you say he and his conspirators are to blame, then I will believe it. I will report to the guild, and ensure we all are on lookout for that gang.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Well, you may consider yourselves exonerated. That you reclaimed the grimoire and your good names says much of your bravery, younglings.

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: Mister Slafborn, we are not younglings!

dialogue.name: YOUZAN
dialogue.text: We are the Doman Adventurers' Guild! All the world will soon know our name, and one day, we'll even be more famous than MissMister Forename!

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: More famous than Forename, eh? Well, I look forward to seeing that.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Well, as one adventurer to another, let me say well done! You outfitted yourselves with honor today, my friends!

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: What brave men and women they are becoming, eh? But they are still in the bloom of youth─growing, yet not fully grown.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: They need a gentle hand to guide them, and a strong arm to protect them. Pray, friend, be that for them.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Anyone who stands before Gagarua must fall!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Hmph. You know your way around a fight, I'll give you that.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Gods above, who are you!?

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Aaarrrggghhh!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Lilina! Oi, Lilina! I'm hurting here!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: <pant> Bloody tiring, this...

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Hm? What're we─ Oh, right!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Ow! That'll leave a bump...

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text:
Hrnnnggg!
...Oooh, I'm going down, I'm going down...
